title: Install pre-commit skill from marketplace
description:

title: Install pre-commit and shellcheck
description:
## Problem Statement
Need pre-commit framework and shellcheck installed. Pre-commit auto-installs other linters (ruff, stylua, eslint, golangci-lint) but these two require manual install.

## Solution Approach
Install via package managers: brew or pip for pre-commit, brew for shellcheck.

## Files to Change
None - system package installation

## Requirements
- pre-commit framework must be installed
- shellcheck must be installed (only linter requiring manual install)
- All other linters (ruff, stylua, eslint, golangci-lint, @typescript-eslint) auto-install via pre-commit

## Expected Outcome
- pre-commit command available: `which pre-commit` succeeds
- shellcheck command available: `which shellcheck` succeeds

## Verification Steps
- [ ] Run: `pre-commit --version` - shows version number
- [ ] Run: `shellcheck --version` - shows version number
- [ ] Run: `which pre-commit` and `which shellcheck` - both found in PATH

## Context
macOS: use brew. Linux: use pip3 for pre-commit, apt/yum for shellcheck.

title: Create .pre-commit-config.yaml with all language hooks
description:
## Problem Statement
Need central pre-commit configuration file with hooks for all supported languages (Markdown, Lua, Bash/Zsh, Python, JS/TS, Go).

## Solution Approach
Create .pre-commit-config.yaml in repository root with universal hooks and language-specific hooks.

## Files to Change
1. `.pre-commit-config.yaml` - CREATE with all hooks configured

## Requirements (from specs/lint-automation/spec.md)
- Markdown: markdownlint-cli2 with --fix
- Shell: shellcheck for static analysis
- Lua: stylua for formatting
- Python: ruff with --fix for linting + formatting
- JavaScript: eslint with --fix
- TypeScript: eslint + @typescript-eslint with --fix
- Go: golangci-lint
- Universal hooks: trailing-whitespace, end-of-file-fixer, check-yaml, check-json, check-merge-conflict, detect-private-key
- All hooks must use pinned `rev:` versions

## Expected Outcome
- File exists at repo root: .pre-commit-config.yaml
- Contains all language hooks with proper configuration
- Ready to run `pre-commit install`

## Verification Steps
- [ ] File exists: `test -f .pre-commit-config.yaml`
- [ ] Valid YAML: `yamllint .pre-commit-config.yaml` OR `python -c 'import yaml; yaml.safe_load(open(".pre-commit-config.yaml"))'`
- [ ] Run: `pre-commit run --all-files` - should execute successfully
- [ ] Verify hooks listed: `grep -E '(markdownlint|shellcheck|stylua|ruff|eslint|golangci)' .pre-commit-config.yaml`

## Context
This is the single source of truth for all linting configuration. Each hook automatically installs its tooling except shellcheck (already installed). Use latest stable versions from https://pre-commit.com/hooks.html

title: Install pre-commit git hooks
description:
## Problem Statement
pre-commit needs to be integrated with git to automatically run before commits.

## Solution Approach
Run 'pre-commit install' to setup git hooks in .git/hooks/pre-commit.

## Files to Change
None directly - modifies .git/hooks/pre-commit (git internal)

## Requirements
- Git hooks must be installed in .git/hooks/
- Hooks must run automatically on git commit
- Linting must happen before commit completes (from specs: Pre-Commit Integration requirement)

## Dependencies
⚠️ This task requires:
- Task df-ja0.2: pre-commit must be installed
- Task df-ja0.3: .pre-commit-config.yaml must exist

## Expected Outcome
- File exists: .git/hooks/pre-commit
- Running git commit triggers linters automatically
- Staged files are linted before commit

## Verification Steps
- [ ] File exists: `test -f .git/hooks/pre-commit`
- [ ] File is executable: `test -x .git/hooks/pre-commit`
- [ ] Test with dummy commit: stage a file, run git commit, verify pre-commit runs
- [ ] Verify hook aborts commit if linting fails

## Context
pre-commit install creates hook that runs configured linters on staged files only. Hook runs before commit is created.

title: Update Claude Code settings to allow pre-commit commands
description:
## Problem Statement
Claude Code needs permission to run pre-commit commands without prompting user each time.

## Solution Approach
Add 'pre-commit' to allowed commands in .claude/settings.json.

## Files to Change
1. `.claude/settings.json` - ADD pre-commit to allowed commands array

## Requirements
- pre-commit must be in allowed commands list
- Claude can run: pre-commit run, pre-commit install, pre-commit autoupdate without permission prompts

## Expected Outcome
- settings.json includes 'Bash(pre-commit:*)' in allowed commands
- Claude can invoke pre-commit without asking permission

## Verification Steps
- [ ] File exists: `test -f .claude/settings.json`
- [ ] Contains pre-commit: `grep 'pre-commit' .claude/settings.json`
- [ ] Valid JSON: `python -c 'import json; json.load(open(".claude/settings.json"))'`
- [ ] Test: Ask Claude to run 'pre-commit --version' - should execute without permission prompt

## Context
This is stowed from claude/.claude/settings.json to ~/.claude/settings.json. Settings apply to all projects when using Claude Code. Add to the existing allowed commands array.

title: Test pre-commit setup with all languages
description:
## Problem Statement
Need to verify pre-commit works correctly for all configured languages and auto-fix functions properly.

## Solution Approach
Test each language hook individually, test manual runs, test git hook integration, verify auto-fix.

## Files to Change
None - testing existing setup

## Requirements (from specs/lint-automation/spec.md)
- Markdown files: markdownlint-cli2 checks and auto-fixes
- Shell scripts: shellcheck performs static analysis
- Lua files: stylua auto-formats
- Python files: ruff checks and auto-fixes
- JavaScript files: eslint checks and auto-fixes
- TypeScript files: eslint + @typescript-eslint checks and auto-fixes
- Go files: golangci-lint checks
- Git-aware: only changed files are checked

## Dependencies
⚠️ This task requires:
- Task df-ja0.2: Tools installed
- Task df-ja0.3: Config file created
- Task df-ja0.4: Git hooks installed

## Expected Outcome
- All language hooks execute successfully
- Auto-fix works for supported languages
- Git hook triggers on commit
- Only staged files are linted

## Verification Steps
- [ ] Test manual run: `pre-commit run --all-files` - executes successfully
- [ ] Test per-language: Create sample files (.md, .sh, .lua, .py, .js, .ts, .go) with intentional issues
- [ ] Verify auto-fix: Check if trailing whitespace, formatting issues are fixed automatically
- [ ] Test git hook: Stage file, run git commit, verify linters run before commit
- [ ] Test selective run: `pre-commit run --files file.py` - only checks that file
- [ ] Claude invocation: Ask Claude to run pre-commit - no permission prompt

## Context
This validates the entire setup. Test files can be temporary and deleted after verification. Some hooks may skip if no files of that type exist.
